alert.note: Alert for Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 17 at 5:56PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Forest Service Bridger Teton Avalanche Center in Jackson has ISSUED a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING which is in effect now until 10 PM Friday... * WHAT...Avalanche warning. The avalanche danger remains very dangerous in the backcountry due to an unusually weak snowpack. * WHERE...The mountains of southeast Idaho, including the Palisades, Elk Mountains and Big Holes. * WHEN...In effect from Wednesday 5:30 PM MST to Friday 10 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Human-triggered avalanches large enough to bury people are very likely to occur on most aspects and elevations in the backcountry. Avoid traveling on or below slopes steeper than 30 degrees. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may be triggered remotely - from flat terrain above, below, and to the sides of steep slopes. Avalanches may involve deeper weak layers of snow and produce a larger avalanche than expected. Avalanches could run onto low angle terrain, hitting paths, roads or groomed snowmobile trails. Consult www.btavy.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
